sentences.sentence: The next day the Swallow( 燕子 ) flew down to the harbor( 港口 ).
He sat high up on a large ship and watched men move heavy things out of it with ropes.
“I am going to Egypt( 埃及，地名 )!” said the Swallow( 燕子 ), but nobody noticed him.
When the moon rose he flew back to the Happy Prince( 王子 ).
“I am coming to say goodbye to you,” he told the Prince( 王子 ).
“Now I will leave for Egypt( 埃及，地名 ).”
“Swallow( 燕子 ), Swallow( 燕子 ), little Swallow( 燕子 ),” said the Prince( 王子 ),
“will you please stay with me for one more night?”
“I have friends waiting for me in Egypt( 埃及，地名 ),” answered the Swallow( 燕子 ).
“It is winter here now, and soon it will become very cold and start to snow.
In Egypt( 埃及，地名 ) the sun is warm and the trees are green, and my friends will all be expecting me to meet them there soon.
Dear Prince( 王子 ), I must leave you, but I will never forget you.
Next spring, I will bring you back two beautiful jewels( 宝石 ), to replace( 替代 ) those you have given away.
The ruby( 红宝石 ) will be redder than a rose, and the sapphire( 蓝宝石 ) will be as blue as the sea.”
“In the city square below,” said the Happy Prince( 王子 ),
“there is a little girl selling matches.
She has dropped her matches in the street, and they have gotten wet and she cannot sell them.
Her father will beat her if she does not bring home some money, and she is crying.
She has no shoes or socks, and she does not have a hat to keep her head warm.
Pull out( 取出 ) my other eye, and give it to her, and her father will not beat her.”
“I will stay with you one night longer,” said the Swallow( 燕子 ),
“but I cannot take your other eye.
You would be completely blind then.”
“Swallow( 燕子 ), Swallow( 燕子 ), little Swallow( 燕子 ),” said the Prince( 王子 ), “do as I tell you.”
So he pulled out the Prince( 王子 )’s other eye, and carried it down to the street.
He flew past the little girl, and dropped the sapphire( 蓝宝石 ) into her hand.
“What a lovely piece of glass!” said the little girl, and she ran home, laughing.
Then the Swallow( 燕子 ) came back to the Prince( 王子 ).
“You are blind now,” he said, “so I will stay with you always.”
“No, little Swallow( 燕子 ),” said the poor Prince( 王子 ), “you must go away to Egypt( 埃及，地名 ).”
“I will stay with you always,” said the Swallow( 燕子 ), and he slept at the Prince( 王子 )’s feet.
All the next day he sat on the Prince( 王子 )’s shoulder, and told him stories of what he had seen in strange lands.
He told him about the long-legged red birds, that catch goldfish in their beaks( 鸟喙 ) along the Nile River( 尼罗河，地名 ).
He told him about the men in the desert( 沙漠 ), who walk slowly by the side of their camels( 骆驼 ),
and carry strings of beads( 珠串 ) in their hands.
And he told him about the Great Pyramids( 金字塔 ), those huge stone buildings where the ancient Kings of Egypt( 埃及，地名 ) are buried( 埋葬 ) in painted coffins( 棺椁 ).
“Dear little Swallow( 燕子 ),” said the Prince( 王子 ),
“you tell me of extraordinary( 令人惊奇的 ) things, but more extraordinary( 令人惊奇的 ) than anything is the suffering( 苦难 ) of men and of women.
Fly over my city, little Swallow( 燕子 ), and tell me what you see there.”
So the Swallow( 燕子 ) flew over the great city, and saw the rich enjoying themselves in their beautiful houses,
while the poor were living in the streets.
He flew along dark roads, and saw the white faces of starving( 十分饥饿的 ) children.
Under a bridge two little boys were lying in each other’s arms to try and keep themselves warm.
“How hungry we are!” they said.
“You must not lie here,” shouted a policeman, and they went out into the rain.
Then the Swallow( 燕子 ) flew back and told the Prince( 王子 ) what he had seen.
“I am covered with fine gold,” said the Prince( 王子 ).
“You must take it off, piece by piece, and give it to the poor of my city.
The living always think that gold can make them happy.”
The Swallow( 燕子 ) pulled off the fine gold piece by piece, until the Happy Prince( 王子 ) looked dull( 无光泽的 ) and grey.
Every time the Swallow( 燕子 ) brought a piece of gold to the poor, the children looked happier and happier, and they laughed and played games in the street.
“We can buy bread now!” they said.

article_info.previous: 把红宝石送给缝纫女工后，做了好事的燕子感受到了温暖。快乐王子请求燕子多呆一晚好把自己的一只眼睛送给一个穷困潦倒的剧作家，帮助其完成创作，燕子同样答应了王子。
article_info.share_words: Then the Swallow came back to the Prince. "You are blind now," he said, "So I will stay with you always."

question.cn: 快乐王子为什么想帮助小女孩？
question.en: Why did the Happy Prince want to help the little girl?

options.cn: 因为如果她不带钱回家的话，她的爸爸会打她。
options.en: Because her father would beat her if she couldn't bring home some money.

options.cn: 因为这个小女孩很可爱。
因为燕子很喜欢这个小女孩。
options.en: Because the Swallow liked the girl very much.

analysis: 文中提到：“she has dropped her matches in the street, and they have gotten wet and she cannot sell them. Her father will beat her if she does bring home some money.”小女孩的火柴都湿了，卖不出去了，但是如果她不带钱回家的话，会挨打，王子很同情她，因此选A。

question.cn: 为什么燕子决定要一直陪着王子？
question.en: Why did the Swallow decide to stay with the Happy Prince always?

options.en: The Happy Prince begged him to stay.

options.cn: 天气太冷了，燕子无法离开。
options.en: The weather was too cold for him to fly away.

analysis: 文中提到：“‘you are blind now,’ he said, ‘so I will stay with you always.’”失去双眼的王子变成了瞎子，因此燕子决定要一直陪着王子，因此选B。

question.cn: 王子瞎了之后，请求燕子做什么？
question.en: What did the Prince ask the Swallow to do when he was blind?

options.cn: 给他讲令人惊奇的故事。
告诉他城中发生了什么。
options.en: To tell him what happened in the city.

analysis: 文中提到：“Fly over my city, little Swallow, and tell me what you see there.”王子让燕子在城市中巡视，并告诉王子他所看到的，因此选B。

question.cn: 为什么燕子要撕下雕像身上的金箔？
question.en: Why did the Swallow take off the gold covered on the statue?

options.en: Because he wanted to sell them for money.
Because he wanted to destroy the statue.

options.cn: 因为快乐王子让他把金子送给穷人。
options.en: Because the Happy Prince asked him to give the gold to the poor.

analysis: 文中提到：“‘I am covered with fine gold,’ said the Prince. ‘You must take it off, piece by piece, and give it to the poor of my city.’”可知，王子让燕子把自己身上的金箔撕下，拿去帮助城市中的穷人，因此选C。

share_title: 100天读完3本英文书，今天是第34天
